intro: Marathrum lacunosum, commonly known as the laceleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely dissected, feathery leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Marathrum lacunosum is often used in traditional medicine and is also appreciated for its ornamental value in gardens.
